Basic meanings of word: Verb: To belong to, to concern
Verb: To load, charge. (Reflexive) To take care of
Verb: To consign, to record, (school) to give detention
Verb: to correspond (+ à), to write to
Verb: to unroll. (reflexive) to unravel, unfold
Verb: To pledge, hire, involve, encourage, enlist, enter into
Verb: to intervene, to take part
Verb: To impose. (Reflexive) To triumph, to be required
Verb: To reapproach, come/bring closer. (reflexive + de) to get closer (to)
Verb: To direct, fulfill, perform, make, realise. Reflexive: to become real
Verb: to collect, gather, obtain. (reflexive) To reflect, meditate
Verb: (transitive) To deceive, trick (incl cheating on a partner). (reflexive) To make a mistake, be wrong.
